arm_group.description: Shock waves are prohibited to enter the body by placebo stand-off

brief_summary.textblock:
The objective of the pilot study is to assess the feasibility of a full randomised,
      placebo-controlled clinical trial.The aim is to demonstrate that penile shockwave
      application in patients with erectile dysfunction of vascular origin leads to a greater
      increase in potency than in the control group.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Study of the Treatment of Erectile Dysfunction With Extracorporeal Shockwave Therapy (ESWT)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Erectile dysfunction for more than 6 months

          -  Informed consent

          -  Positive effect of PDE-5-Hammer

          -  IIEF-15 score less than 20

          -  No neurological desease

          -  Stable partnership for more than 3 months

          -  Age 18-75

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Total prostatectomy

          -  Another reason for DE except for vascular disorder

          -  Clinically significant hematological desease

          -  Heart stroke, Arrythmia during the last 6 months

          -  Cancer dureing tha last 5 years

          -  Intake of antiandrogen

          -  ED treatment with the last 7 days

          -  IIEF score higher than, equal to 20

          -  Previous shockwave treatment

intervention.description: shock waves are applied extracoporealy with 0.1mJ/mm2 through placebo stand-off which prohibits the shock waves to enter the body

clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Randomised, Blinded, Placebo-controlled Pilot Study of the Treatment of Erectile Dysfunction With Extracorporeal Shockwave Therapy (ESWT)

authority: Austria: Federal Office for Safety in Health Care
Germany: Federal Institute for Drugs and Medical Devices

primary_outcome.measure: Effects of erection problems on the sex life (International Index of Erectile Function Questionnaire)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of erection (Quality of Erection Questionnaire)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At screening, 1, 3 and 6 months post treatment

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment
clinical_study.why_stopped: It has been decided to improve the inclusion criteria for better study outcome
